title: [AVR] 'layout decided on a larger discriminant type (I32) than typeck (I16)'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Compiling the below program:

```
#![no_std]

#[repr(C)]
pub enum A {
    MkA(B),
}

#[derive(Clone, Copy)]
#[repr(C)]
struct B {
    c: C,
}

#[derive(Clone, Copy)]
#[repr(C)]
struct C {
}
```

for an AVR target results in the following error message:

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'layout decided on a larger discriminant type (I32) than typeck (I16)', /rustc/c8e6a9e8b6251bbc8276cb78cabe1998deecbed7/compiler/rustc_abi/src/layout.rs:687:13

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.69.0-nightly (c8e6a9e8b 2023-01-23) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no -Z unstable-options

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [layout_of] computing layout of `A`
#1 [lint_mod] linting top-level module
#2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate
```
